ratings.comment: Dr. Vierstra is a great lecturer and I would take him again despite my serious lack of interest in botany. He's a funny guy and is really passionate about what he teaches, and his tests were extremely fair. Very clear lectures. And low key, he's quite attractive for his age. I'd recommend him!

Vierstra was the second best professor of the three for 152. Everything for his exams are on the powerpoint, but there is A LOT of material. Reading the book is a waste of time, but make sure you know every single word on every slide. Pay close attention in class. Overall, nice guy, made some funny jokes.

Pretty chill guy. Makes a lot of sex references with plants which is just uncomfortable for everyone. Don't bother reading the book, everything is on the lecture slides. Lots of info, just study and you'll be fine. Oh, watch out for the wording on the exam. The questions will try to trip you up.
Tries to use some humor to keep the students awake. Didn't give the answer key for the practice exam. The exam itself was pretty easy, just  a lot of information.

Okay teacher, but tried a little bit too hard with all his jokes. Presented a lot of information which was actually fairly interesting (considering how much plants suck) but near exam time you got a little bit worried about how much you'd need to know. You're allowed a notecard but I didn't need to use it at all. Super easy exam.

I tried to keep an open mind when writing this review because, well, plants suck. he loves them though and does his best to make them interesting, as hard as that is. he really knows what he's talking about and is a pretty reasonable guy. his exam was very tricky though. be sure to reread every question numerous times to avoid dumb mistakes.

He truly made plants interesting. May come across as a hard ass but I can tell he's a nice guy. Material all in the powerpoints. (pay attention to highlighted items) I suggest reading the book too because it definitely helps. (only 6-7 chapters)  Test was definitely fair. High recommendations.
His class was easy....but BORING. He team taught with Tony Stretton and Tim Allen for zoo 152, and I preferred him the least out of the 3. If you like powerpoints then you'll love him.

He explains things really well and does not get very scientific, which makes things easy to learn.  He is also interesting, pretty funny, and jolly.  Certainly keeps you awake in class.  Probably the best Zoo Prof I had.

Gives out previous year's exam to study from, which was incredibly helpful.  Overall, you will need to work at it, but Vierstra makes studying plants less painful w/ jokes and short film clips of plants growing and the like.
One of the best Zoo prof's you can get.  Not hard and very interesting.
Guy was great... really funny sexual references to his plant structures.  Easy test too if you ask me.  Read the book... lecture was barely tested on at all.

Let me be frank: He's a very challenging professor. Don't worry about reading the book with him, but he will ask the most picky questions (on tests) from his powerpoint slides, so master those. There are no shortcuts for him.  Put in the work and you will do well.
I really enjoy him as a professor.  His lectures are great compared to who I had last semester.  He does have weird jokes, but he is very clear and easy to learn from.

BORING lecturer with crude political and phallic jokes.  He specializes in plants and any plant picture he shows he relates a sexual reference to.  Class time is no place to lecture to us about politics.  Plus, his nickname is 'Tricky Rick' for his exams.
